titleproper.value: Guide to the Nancy Henderson Plays <num>MSS 104</num>

author.value: Collection processed by Jennifer E. Neal

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-07-19T15:33:04</date>

abstract.value: Nancy Wallace Henderson is an American playwright and author. Materials include six plays published between 1954 and 1993, and two programs.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Nancy Henderson Plays; MSS 066; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.
Donated by Nancy Wallace Henderson in 1995. The accession number related to this is 0.104.

Nancy Wallace Henderson is an American playwright and author. Originally from North Carolina, Henderson majored in Dramatic Art at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. There she studied playwriting under Walter Prichard Eaton and continued her studies in New York with Benjamin Bernard Zavin. Henderson won awards from the Dramatics Alliance in California and the University of Wisconsin, and was a member of the Author's Guild, the Dramatics Guild, and the International Women's Writing Guild.
Materials include six plays published between 1954 and 1993, one of which was co-authored by Charlotte Kraft, and two programs.
